title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct answer.

E° = 1.50 V – 0.16 V = 1.34 V
descriptions:
Student earns 0/1 point(s)

1 point is earned for the correct answer.

E° = 1.50 V – 0.16 V = 1.34 V

Student earns 1/1 point(s)

1 point is earned for the correct answer.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct answer and a valid justification.

The mass of the Pt(s) electrode remains the same because the Pt does not react and no Cu atoms will be deposited on the Pt electrode.
descriptions:
Student earns 0/1 point(s)

1 point is earned for the correct answer and a valid justification.

The mass of the Pt(s) electrode remains the same because the Pt does not react and no Cu atoms will be deposited on the Pt electrode.

Student earns 1/1 point(s)

1 point is earned for the correct answer and a valid justification.

The mass of the Pt(s) electrode remains the same because the Pt does not react and no Cu atoms will be deposited on the Pt electrode.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for a valid explanation.

In a redox reaction, the number of electrons lost must equal the number gained, so the net charge must be zero. The total charge of the cations is less than the total charge of the anions.
descriptions:
Student earns 0/1 point(s)

1 point is earned for a valid explanation.

In a redox reaction, the number of electrons lost must equal the number gained, so the net charge must be zero. The total charge of the cations is less than the total charge of the anions.

Student earns 1/1 point(s)

1 point is earned for a valid explanation.

In a redox reaction, the number of electrons lost must equal the number gained, so the net charge must be zero. The total charge of the cations is less than the total charge of the anions.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct calculation of the number of moles.

Part i

0.185gAu× 1molAu 196.97gAu =9.39× 10 −4 molAu

Part ii

1 point is earned for the correct number of electrons transferred (may be implicit).

1 point is earned for the correct calculation of the current.

I= q t = 9.39× 10 −4 molAu× 3mol e − 1molAu ×96,485 C mole − 30.0min× 60sec 1min

= 0.151 C/s = 0.151 A

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for a correct calculation of the solubility of CuCl

1 point is earned for identifying the precipitate with the lower solubility.

For CuCl:

CuCl(s) → Cu+(aq) + Cl-(aq)

Ksp = [Cu+][Cl-]

1.7 × 10-7 = x2

x = 4.1 × 10-4 M = solubility of CuCl

CuCl has a lower solubility compared to CuCl2 and will precipitate first.
descriptions:
Student earns 0/2 point(s)

1 point is earned for identifying the precipitate with the lower solubility.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for a correct choice and a valid justification.

Disagree

The precipitate will decrease [Cu+], which will cause Q to increase and become closer to the value of K. Therefore, the voltage of the cell will decrease.

Student earns 0/1 point(s)
